content.description:
Starts on the arête using a side crimp. Go up and mainly left using big slopey holds and poor feet going through the two scoops and up to the top from there. There is a tree just to the right of the route.

Written as a V1 in the urban rock guide, but myself and others

felt

like it was a V1+, or maybe V2, or V5? Whatever it feels like to you, hop on and enjoy!
content.location: Two Scoops is just to the left of the tree on the backside of the B1 boulder. Starts on the arête and goes left and up.

content.description: Try and figure this one out without beta, you'll be glad you did - a wonderful unlikely sequence of almost zen-like moves leads to a small crimper (used to be a nice jug) then smearing and stemming lead to the final crux sloper. From here, commitment will lead you to the top.
content.protection:
Crashpads and spotters.

Video

Video of more

here.

8/24/20: ^ The above video is 12 years old. Like most problems at Stoney, many holds have broken on Masters. The crux remains the same but the lower sequence is different than the video shown because certain holds are not there anymore.

content.description: A link-up. Start at "the corner", make thin but fun moves right around the corner and into the starting holds of Hog-tied, then up.
content.location: Left side of B1 boulder, starts almost at the down climb (corner)

content.description:
Highball with the crux at the top - some may prefer to toprope.

Use big holds to the left of Masters Of Reality to reach a very big and committing move about 15 feet off the deck. This moves gets you to a hold which could be better. The crux is utilizing this to gain the top.

The taller you are the easier this will feel.
content.location: West face of B1, highest part of face

content.description: Sit start to Flying Circus. Put your butt in the sand and grab two bad and very narrow slopers. Compress the heck out of these and use some heel trickery to get stood up in the start holds of Flying Circus. Now you just need to do that whole problem and you're done! :)
content.location: Sit start on obvious vertical slopers.

content.description: Great route on the opposite side of the arete from The Crack. Start left hand on the arete on a slopey sidepull and right hand on a sharp sidepull on the face. From here, use the arete and some technical footwork to do a big right hand deadpoint move to a lonely pocket on an otherwise smooth face. Once you stick the pocket don't get too excited as it's not over. Use good footwork or raw power to find your way to the flat ledge above.
content.location: To the right of the crack.  Starts on the arête.

content.description: Awesome route in between Master of Reality and the ear.  Sit start low beneath the good right holds of Master of Reality. Slap your way up the arête here using side pulls to set yourself up high to reach some bad slopers near the top.  This seems to be the crux so make sure there's a pad under you at least. Finish straight up.
content.location: On the arête to the right of Master of Reality right as your walk to the area from Boulder 1.

content.description: sit start to the left, go for a finger pocket then straight up for the top out
content.location: sit start to the left of the crack

content.description:
There are several different ways to do this problem... I believe the sit start adds some difficulty (V6?), and, depending on who you ask, a hold may be "off". Hey, it's Stoney; isn't everything an eliminate?

Begin on the lowest hold/holds in the "ear" and either bust out right (good incut) and mantle or mantle from the positive right hand gaston. A semi-good smear for the left foot helps the mantle. Get established, and reach up with the left hand to a small but positive undercling/undercling-gaston then try to stand-up in the "ear". This part may be easier said than done for taller folks. Reach up and right-ish to a decent slimper (slopey-crimper) and top-out using good footholds and jugs.
content.location: If walking from Boulder1, the Ear is, as the name suggests, the ear-shaped feature on the arete of the B1 boulder, and is across from Crowd Pleaser (on the Turlock Boulder). It is right of Master of Reality and Expansion Chamber, left of ELP, Apesma, Waugh Cross-through, Titty Fuck, etc.

content.description: Stack pads or jump to reach left pocket and right crimp/pinch thing.  Campus up to OK rail, then find som feet that work and fire up to sloppy top-out.
content.location: Right of the ear on the face above the "skull"

content.description: Starts off on Crack Direct but veers left and merges with Apesma into a cruxy gaston to a slopey bulging topout.
content.protection: Couple of pads and a spotter
content.location: Located in the middle of Boulder 1 to the left of The Crack.

content.description:
Start matched in an awkwardly angled under cling at the bottom right of this problem. Find a way to get over to the slopey jug on the left and from here use a fingerlock/pocket, another slopey jug, and some dynamic movement to get to the top of the problem. The committing move over the top is a fitting finish.

A classic V5 variation eliminates the fingerlock/pocket on the right and the jug on the right to only use the left most holds (and the under cling) to get up this problem.

Pat yourself on the back when done - it's a milestone problem.

Video

here.
content.location: This boulder is in what is arguably Stoney's most famous and populous area. If you park on Topanga Canyon Rd and enter from the main entrance it's a straight walk down the trail probably about 4 minutes. You'll first see the giant Turlock boulder directly on the trail and right around the other side of it to the left is B1 Boulder which has The Crack on its right side.

content.description: Same line as The Crack (V3), but you don't get either of the finger pockets on the right above the start hold or the jug on the right side near the top. Thanks Mike Stephan.
Short but sweet problem only a couple moves long.  Probably the easiest problem on B1 Boulder
content.location:
Starts out on the north side of the Northwest corner on the well chalked right facing sidepulls.  Go up and trend left following the good holds.  Short but sweet.

Walkoff / downclimb by the tree.

content.description: Awesome and powerful climb up the middle of the B1 boulder.  Start with the right hand in the deep pocket and the first move goes to the obvious sloping rail.  Go straight up from there.  Many variations exist.
content.location: First independent line left of the crack.  Starts in deep pocket
